29: This document establishes exponential KL-convergence using a **strictly weaker assumption** that we **already have**:
30: 
31: :::{prf:axiom} Confining Potential (from 04_convergence.md, Axiom 1.3.1)
32: :label: ax-confining-recap
33: 
34: The potential $U: \mathcal{X} \to \mathbb{R}$ satisfies:
35: 
36: $$
37: U(x) \to +\infty \quad \text{as} \quad |x| \to \infty \quad \text{or} \quad x \to \partial \mathcal{X}
38: $$
39: 
40: Equivalently, there exist constants $\alpha_U > 0$ and $R_0 > 0$ such that:
41: 
42: $$
43: \langle \nabla U(x), x \rangle \geq \alpha_U |x|^2 \quad \text{for all} \quad |x| \geq R_0

hints.label: thm-nonconvex-informal
hints.title: Exponential KL Convergence for Non-Convex Fitness (Informal)
hints.content:
58: :label: thm-nonconvex-informal
59: 
60: For the N-particle Euclidean Gas with a **confining potential** (Axiom {prf:ref}`ax-confining-recap`) but **no convexity assumption**:
61: 
62: $$
63: D_{\text{KL}}(\mu_t \| \pi_{\text{QSD}}) \leq e^{-\lambda t} D_{\text{KL}}(\mu_0 \| \pi_{\text{QSD}})
64: $$
65: 
66: where:
67: 
68: $$
69: \lambda = c \cdot \min\left(\gamma, \frac{\alpha_U}{\sigma_v^2}\right) - C \cdot L_g \cdot G_{\max}
70: $$
